column1: RELEASE: Wagner Releases Statement on Coronavirus Stimulus Legislation  Read my full statement here ➡️  https://t.co/fL7UpmHo3K
Please join me in praying for the quick recovery of @POTUS @FLOTUS and all those across the country and here in Missouri who have contracted COVID-19.

This week I spoke on the House Floor in support of H.R. 2166 the bipartisan Global Health Security Act.   This important bill will greatly bolster the United States’ ability to prevent and respond to global health threats like the coronavirus pandemic.

I have been hearing from employers across the Second District of Missouri who desperately need Congress to do its job & pass coronavirus relief legislation so they can do their job and keep handing out paychecks to their hardworking employees. Watch here.  https://t.co/SqfDWgsT1i

I appreciated the opportunity to meet with Dr. Alex Garza head of the St. Louis Metropolitan Pandemic Task Force. I’m impressed with the high level of cooperation and expertise our area health care systems have focused on combatting the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/VtXWtEuvRh

My heart breaks for the Rohingya who have suffered unimaginable atrocities at the hands of the genocidal Burmese regime and now face an incipient coronavirus outbreak in Cox’s Bazar Bangladesh.  The House Foreign Affairs Committee held a subcommittee hearing this week...
I joined a bipartisan group of my colleagues in the House to call on House Leadership to include my Calculate PPP Forgiveness Act in the next coronavirus relief package.

The Foreign Affairs subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific held a hearing on China’s maritime ambitions. I'm deeply concerned that domestic discontent & international distraction resulting from the coronavirus pandemic is pushing Beijing to behave erratically and aggressively...

I testified at the @China_TaskForce hearing in support of my legislation to hold China accountable for its response to COVID-19.  From the outset of this devastating pandemic the CCP suppressed misrepresented and falsified info necessary to prevent the extent of this crisis.

...before we waived the distribution requirement due to COVID-19 as part of the CARES Act. The IRS is now allowing anyone who took their RMD from an eligible plan to put the money back without penalty. The deadline is August 31 2020. More info here  https://t.co/k8lAcbGhbE
I appreciated the opportunity to meet with the Renewable Fuels Association this week to discuss the impact COVID-19 has had on the renewable fuels industry. https://t.co/NgGs51ZDM9

China intentionally misrepresented and suppressed vital information that could have mitigated the spread of the coronavirus.  Read my op-ed on legislation I introduced to hold China accountable for its actions here.  https://t.co/trIKtzS55m

It is undeniable China intentionally misrepresented & suppressed vital information that could have mitigated the spread of the coronavirus.  Read more about my legislation to hold China accountable for these actions here ➡️  https://t.co/vezfRNxwsK
I went on @thisweekinmopol to talk about our most recent work in Congress to address COVID-19.  Watch my full interview here.  https://t.co/riia8L4svW
Tune in now to watch our live town hall on COVID-19. #MOTownHall https://t.co/K3QK3w9PAB
RELEASE: Bipartisan Bicameral Group of Lawmakers Introduces Legislation to Counter Human Rights Abuses Worldwide Amidst Coronavirus Pandemic  Read more ➡️  https://t.co/wYWsW3xsVp
Join me tonight for a town hall where I answer your questions about what we're doing to address the coronavirus pandemic.  #MOTownHall https://t.co/9XVGY9iHa0

.@MOTreasurer released the COVID-19 relief funding each county will get from the CARES Act Congress passed. St. Louis County will receive $173.5 million St. Charles County will receive $47.1 million & Jefferson County will receive $26.4 million to address COVID-19 related costs.

I fought to make sure this bill also included $75 billion for hospitals and health care providers and $25 billion for critical COVID-19 testing so we can better understand the spread of this virus and prevent more lives from being lost.  https://t.co/Ffz0xG1OiG

...as we join together to combat COVID-19.  The Paycheck Protection Program has helped over 45000 Missouri businesses just like St. Louis-based Martha’s Hands a home health care provider with over 200 employees.

I spoke on the House Floor to urge my colleagues to vote in favor of our latest coronavirus relief legislation the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act.  This legislation is poised to be a lifeline for Missouri workers and small businesses...

If you are a veteran with a disability affected by the coronavirus Disabled American Veterans created a COVID-19 Relief Fund that may be able to help you.  See here for more information on the fund.  https://t.co/NPdUsjqVPj

At the onset of this pandemic the CCP engaged in a concerted coverup regarding the extent of the coronavirus spread and human-to-human transmission including by arresting doctors who sought to expose the true threat the virus posed.
It is clear that fear of offending the Communist Party of China (CCP) contributed to the World Health Organization’s mismanagement of the initial COVID-19 response.

If you are self-employed a gig worker or an independent contractor who has been affected by the coronavirus you could qualify for unemployment assistance.    File an unemployment claim with the Missouri Department of Labor here.  https://t.co/6A5HqJ7FEP
I joined my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to call on House and Senate leadership to reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) in our next tranche of COVID-19 legislation...

I joined Mark Reardon on KMOX this week to give a coronavirus update & talk more about the Paycheck Protection Program Congress created to help our small businesses stay open & keep workers employed during this pandemic. Listen to our full interview here.  https://t.co/VJuAyGdxfz

Join me and Dr. Randall Williams Director of the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services today at 5pm for a telephone town hall on COVID-19 and how we are working to stop the spread of the virus and support our workers businesses and frontline health care personnel.
...flatten the curve. People across Missouri need to understand the severity of the COVID-19 threat stay in their homes and not leave unless necessary. (2/3)

I had the opportunity to personally inform the County Executives they are receiving these funds and am confident they will be able to put them to good use to address the numerous impacts of the coronavirus.
I am extremely pleased to announce the Department of Housing and Urban Development has moved quickly and will disburse coronavirus relief funds Congress authorized just last week in the CARES Act.
I joined Annie Frey today to go over the Coronavirus relief legislation the House passed and the President signed into law.   Listen here to learn more.   https://t.co/7Kr7IhKrqC
READ HERE: My full statement in support of the coronavirus relief legislation the House just passed.  https://t.co/30X6OZASjW

..two goals that should be at the forefront of every decision we make. Unfortunately Democrats have decided to use this critical moment to attempt to jam in liberal pet projects unrelated to the coronavirus pandemic all at the expense of Americans who look to us for leadership.

If you have come into contact w/ someone who has COVID-19 or if you have symptoms I encourage you to call your healthcare provider to determine if you need to be tested. For more detailed symptom &  testing information from the CDC read more here: https://t.co/hOPkf5UOBF.

I continue to hear from many constituents about the unconscionable shortage of coronavirus tests. This shortage is completely unacceptable and I share your frustration and anger.  I have spoken to the Administration to make that clear.
I wanted to give you an update so you had the most up-to-date details on the coronavirus testing situation and provide you the best guidance on testing so you and your loved ones can remain safe.

It has been clear that the United States must take strong and decisive action to stop the spread of the Coronavirus and prevent further loss of life and economic insecurity. Read my full statement on the legislation the House passed to address the Coronavirus here. https://t.co/Ss2g1nI2oV

Mercy is opening a drive thru testing site.   Make sure you call their COVID-19 Clinical Support Line at 314-251-0500 for more information.                                       https://t.co/ZWE4Ku3akk
For updated information on the coronavirus visit the @HealthyLivingMo link here:  https://t.co/smfyMBnyDu https://t.co/k5wTIcwGBI
Our top priority must be addressing the coronavirus to ensure the health and safety of our communities not playing politics at such an uncertain time.  (2/2)
I joined Governor Mike Parson and St. Louis County Executive Sam Page for a press conference announcing the first presumptive positive case of coronavirus in Missouri. https://t.co/oiarszvpq8

...than $4 billion to ensure that diagnostic tests are widely available invest in the development & procurement of a vaccine protect our medical supply chain & treat coronavirus patients. It will also give the CDC $2.2 billion to support robust state & local response efforts.

I just voted in favor of $7.8 billion in emergency funding to help our workers and government officials respond to the spread of the coronavirus.  The bill passed in an extraordinarily bipartisan manner and will appropriate more...
